intro: Oldenlandia fraterna, commonly known as the "Friendship flower" or "Blue mist vine," is a tropical flowering plant native to Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, blue or violet flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is commonly found in rainforests and along stream banks. The genus Oldenlandia belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants.
